Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery oinochoe; white slip; exterior: oblique bars representing wing feathers, filled with dots.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1886,0401.1125 and 1886,0401.1267.d. The sherd also belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.35 and 1924,1201.36. According to Cook, the decoration seems to have been inspired by the conventional representation of a bird, specifically a partridge: scales for the breast feathers and bars for the folded wings. The breast-feather panel narrowing towards the bottom and the red on these feathers are unusual; the black bands are unusually wide. For a complete oinochoe with this decoration, see Walter-Karydi 1973, pl. 4, no. 47 from Rhodes. For parallels, see Louvre A321 from Camiros.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 247, no. 3b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.145)
